content.description: Sit start on a sidepull with feet on the face underneath. Move up on more obvious sidepulls and crimps to the top
content.location: West side of still waters boulder

content.description: From a small rock below the slanting crack, lean over the water to start. Start matched at the lowest part of the crack. Move up and right on good crimps
content.protection: Because there is water beneath you, you cant really pad it but it is not very tall with a flat water cushioned landing.

content.description: Start as for West Overhang but make a long move out right to a flat, slick finger ledge. Work further on a knob and re-situate the feet to begin up to a good crimp and top out.

NE side of boulder, SDS ontop a small rock below the slanting crack. Start matched at wider spot of crack and work up and left a few moves then bust straight up to a good hold at the lip and top out. (Variation of "Still Waters Run Deep")
content.location: NE side of boulder next to the south side of the river by the trail.

content.description: NE side of boulder, SDS ontop a small rock below the slanting crack. Start matched at wider spot of crack and work up and left till you can put your foot on large ledge and then climb up face on crimp/edges.
content.location: NE side of boulder next to the south side of the river by the trail.

content.description: Start on the obvious rail and work up on crimps and a small pinch on the right arete. Work feet and make fun moves to the top
content.location: South face of boulder, across from the Thumb boulder

content.description:
On the south side of the boulder start on sitting atop the rock in the landing in the horizontal seam. Â Avoid the arete to the right and use the left hand crimp on the face to pull through!

This is probably a eliminate of "South Face".
content.protection: Because of dab potential hard to pad.
content.location: On the south side of the boulder.

content.description: Same start as "Pit your Wits" but instead of going up and left, or even straight up, off route the huge jugs above and do a hard sequence due right.
content.location: South East corner of the "Still Waters Run Deep" Boulder in the small pit there.

content.description:
A hard opening sequence leads to a huge jug. Start ridiculously low in the pit with right hand on an obvious big side pull jug (maybe save room for another appendage?) and left hand on a small opposing crimp. Slap, slap and away you go!

After hitting the large ledge either go straight up or go into South Face for a little bit more difficulty.
content.location: On the south east corner of the "Still Waters" boulder

content.description: Start on the right end of the small overhang. Left hand groping the fin/pinchy feature and right hand on a small crimp just above the overhang. One big move to a great right facing ledge then top out.
